fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Hazardous substances, biodiversity, climate adaptation, climate mitigation and energy efficiency, water, health, air quality, noise reduction.
organisation_name: City of Stockholm, Environment and Health Committee (Stockholm MF)
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
goals__remit: The City of Stockholm's Environment and Health Administration, MF, is the authority responsible for the environmental health of the City. MF has approximately 200 employees. The long-term target is for Stockholm to be continue to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases at the same rate as between 1990 and 2005, thus achieving the goal “Fossil Fuel Free City 2040”. The environmental work in the City is guided by the Environment Program and Stockholm’s Action Program on Climate Change (SACC).
